articles.headline: What Recession? Some Economists See Chances of a Growth Rebound.
articles.snippet: The Federal Reserve has raised rates rapidly. But instead of cracking, some data point to an economy that’s thriving.
articles.abstract: The Federal Reserve has raised rates rapidly. But instead of cracking, some data point to an economy that’s thriving.
articles.lead_paragraph: Many economists and investors had a clear narrative coming into 2023: The Federal Reserve had spent months pushing borrowing costs rapidly higher in a bid to tame inflation, and those moves were expected to slow growth and the labor market so much that the economy would be at risk of plunging into a downturn.

articles.headline: ‘No More Antakya’: Turks Say Quake Wiped Out a City, and a Civilization
articles.snippet: Amid scenes of utter devastation and widespread suffering in the bitter cold, residents mourned the loss of family, friends and memories.
articles.abstract: Amid scenes of utter devastation and widespread suffering in the bitter cold, residents mourned the loss of family, friends and memories.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANTAKYA, Turkey — They bedded down anywhere they could: on lightless street corners, in grassy little parks, next to an elementary school, on a hillside down from one of the world’s earliest Christian churches.
articles.byline: By Vivian Yee and Nimet Kirac

articles.headline: U.K. Economy Sputters and Barely Avoids a Recession
articles.snippet: Economic growth was unchanged in the fourth quarter, and only slow expansion is expected in the years ahead.
articles.abstract: Economic growth was unchanged in the fourth quarter, and only slow expansion is expected in the years ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: The British economy narrowly avoided a recession at the end of last year, data published on Friday showed, but it is still smaller than it was before the pandemic, and economists predict that it will take several years for Britain to make up that lost output.

articles.headline: How to Prepare for a Possible Layoff
articles.snippet: What you should do while you are still employed, how to retain important data and what you should be doing with your money.
articles.abstract: What you should do while you are still employed, how to retain important data and what you should be doing with your money.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tech booms and busts are nothing new, so the recent layoffs at places like Facebook and Google may not be that surprising. The media industry is its own perpetual roller-coaster ride, so forced departures from NBC News and Gannett are understandable.
articles.byline: By Brian X. Chen, Emma Goldberg and Ron Lieber

articles.headline: Life After Layoffs: A Financial Guide
articles.snippet: How to get a handle on your finances after being let go from your job.
articles.abstract: How to get a handle on your finances after being let go from your job.
articles.lead_paragraph: Losing a job ranks as one of life’s biggest stressors, something tens of thousands of workers have experienced in recent weeks, many for the first time.
articles.byline: By Tara Siegel Bernard and Ron Lieber

articles.headline: Fetterman, Recovering After Stroke, Labors to Adjust to Life in the Senate
articles.snippet: The first-term Democrat, who was released Friday after two days in the hospital, is coping with the lasting effects of a near-fatal stroke last year, and Congress is adapting to accommodate him.
articles.abstract: The first-term Democrat, who was released Friday after two days in the hospital, is coping with the lasting effects of a near-fatal stroke last year, and Congress is adapting to accommodate him.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At Senator John Fetterman’s desk in the Senate chamber, there is a newly installed monitor that rises or lowers, depending on whether he sits or stands, and provides closed captioning so he can follow the proceedings. At the center dais, a custom desk stand has been built to accommodate the same technology for when he takes his shifts presiding over the Senate.

articles.headline: In Post-Roe World, These Conservatives Embrace a New Kind of Welfare
articles.snippet: Some conservative thinkers are pushing Republicans to move on from Reagan-era family policy and send cash to families. A few lawmakers are listening.
articles.abstract: Some conservative thinkers are pushing Republicans to move on from Reagan-era family policy and send cash to families. A few lawmakers are listening.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sending cash to parents, with few strings attached. Expanding Medicaid. Providing child care subsidies to families earning six figures.

articles.headline: Russia to Cut Oil Output in Response to Western Sanctions
articles.snippet: The country’s announcement that it will reduce production by about 5 percent sent the price of oil higher.
articles.abstract: The country’s announcement that it will reduce production by about 5 percent sent the price of oil higher.
articles.lead_paragraph: Russia announced on Friday that it would cut its oil production next month by 500,000 barrels a day, or about 5 percent of its output — Moscow’s first substantive response to a wave of recently imposed sanctions on the country’s oil trade.
